Jim Dixon wrote:
> On Sun, 28 Sep 2003, trz wrote:
> 
>>> Look at the bytecode.  Whenever you call
>>> 
> com.funnyfarm.toplevel.deeper.deeperstill.getondown.WeAreFinallyTher
>>> e,
>>> it's in the bytecode, each and every character.
> 
> Now try to read this, carefully.
> 
> The name is in the bytecode.
> 
> Each and every character.

How did you look at it?


>> Hi,
>> I checked
>> 
>> 
> http://java.sun.com/docs/books/vmspec/2nd->
> edition/html/Compiling.doc.h 
>> tml#14787
>> 
>> and I do not think the method name is used every time a method is
>> called, just an index to the method.
> 
> This is not how to conduct an argument.
> 
> You have to pay some attention, just a little, to what is being said.

Did you take a look at the document? It seems actually to *specify* that
the method name *is not* encoded every where the method is called. To
me, this argument carries some weight...

Take care, Ilja
